item.title: Rats everywhere around the lower side of crystal palace park, 26th September
item.description:
I have lived here for 6 months and there hasn't been one visit to the park where I have not seen a rat, it is always in the day time too. It concerns me deeply due to the different diseases they can carry and there are so many children and dogs around too as its always near the dinosaurs. Is there some budget located to getting rid of the rats within the park renovation budget?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Grove, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bexley Council green wheelie bin flytipped on public grass verge at the junction of Merewood Road and Barnehurst Avenue - Countrystyle operatives have visited and did not remove bin., 26th September
item.description:
Unable to update the most recent report as its again been made an Internal referral - a Countrystyle vehicle arrived at the location of the bin on 26/09 at 10:55, an operative picked up paper litter on the grass verge around the fly tipped bin and then returned to the vehicle and drove off. The bin remains fly tipped and still requires removal by the Council or it contractor. This bin was flytipped on 18/09/25 after the normal bin collection round had been completed on this date. No resident has reclaimed the bin, so it was not misplaced during the 18/09 bin collection and it has not been retrieved during the bin collection rounds completed on 25/09. The bin has been deliberately placed on its side, tucked out the way, indicating this is not accidental. The initial report made on 18/09 was updated by London Borough of Bexley at 12:34 and State changed to: Internal referral. No further action has been taken since this date. The bin needs to be regarded as flytipped and removed by the council

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnehurst Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
